This is your default string table. You can add strings to it from anywhere with the 'Add New String' command, or by right-clicking this stbl in the file explorer.

You can also press the 'New Entry' button in this JSON file, and a new entry will be added with a unique hash. For the string, just type right here in the JSON (remember to escape special characters, such as ", \, and \n).
While working on tuning, you can press 'Copy as XML' to quickly paste this string's key and comment into XML.
Finally, VS Code tip: You can press ALT + Z (Windows) or OPTION + Z (macOS) to toggle line wrapping. This may make editing JSONs with long lines easier for you.
